item.title: How to prepare Paneer Tikka?
item.description: Paneer Tikka is a well-loved Indian starter made with paneer (a type of Indian cheese) that is marinated in spices and yogurt, then grilled or baked for a smoky, tasty treat. Here's how you can make it at home in easy-to-understand language: Ingredients: 250 grams paneer, cut into cubes ½ cup thick yogurt (hung curd) 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste 1 tablespoon lemon juice 1 teaspo
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Mango Pickle?
item.description: Making mango pickle, or aam ka achar, is a fun way to keep the tangy taste of raw mangoes using tasty spices. Here’s a simple recipe to make mango pickle at home: Ingredients: 3-4 raw mangoes (about 500 grams), firm and sour 1/2 cup mustard oil (or any cooking oil) 2 tablespoons mustard seeds 1 tablespoon fenugreek seeds 1 tablespoon fennel seeds 1/2 teaspoon asafoetida 2 teaspoons turme
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Moong Dal Khichdi
item.description: Moong Dal Khichdi is a healthy and comforting dish made with rice, split yellow moong dal (lentils), and mild spices. It’s easy to digest and is especially enjoyed during cold weather or when you're not feeling well. item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Tomato Soup
item.description: Tomato soup is a classic comfort food that is easy to prepare and perfect for any time of the year. item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

It's a wonderful combination of textures and flavors, making it a popular street food. item.title: How to prepare Chana Chaat
item.description: Chana Chaat is a delicious, tangy and healthy Indian street food made with chickpeas, fresh vegetables, and flavorful spices. It's quick to prepare and perfect as a snack or light meal. item.title: How to prepare JalJeera
item.description: JalJeera is a traditional Indian summer drink known for its refreshing and tangy taste. Made with a blend of spices, herbs, and tangy lemon, it is both a thirst quencher and an appetizer. item.title: How to prepare Pudina Rice
item.description: Pudina Rice, also known as Mint Rice, is a flavorful and aromatic dish made with fresh mint leaves, rice, and spices. It's a refreshing and light meal that can be served as a main dish or a side. item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Green Mango Salad
item.description: Green Mango Salad, also known as Som Tum in Thai cuisine, is a refreshing and tangy dish that combines the tartness of green mangoes with the crunch of vegetables and the kick of spices. item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Dal Palak
item.description: Dal Palak is a nutritious and delicious dish made with lentils and spinach. item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.description: Pani Puri is a fun and delicious twist on the classic Indian street food, Pani Puri (or Golgappa). This snack involves small, crispy puris filled with a tangy, spicy, and flavorful water (pani) along with a savory filling. item.description: Kala Khatta Gola, also known as Kala Khatta Ice Gola or Black Currant Ice Gola, is a popular Indian street treat, especially during the summer. This refreshing dessert is made with crushed ice, flavored syrup, and a blend of tangy and spicy seasonings. item.title: How to prepare Dhokla
item.description: Dhokla is a popular Gujarati snack that is steamed and made from fermented rice and chickpea flour (besan). It's light, spongy, and usually served with green chutney. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.description: Sattu Paratha is a delicious and nutritious stuffed flatbread popular in the Indian states of Bihar, Jharkhand, and Uttar Pradesh. It is made with sattu (roasted gram flour) and various spices, creating a savory filling wrapped in a whole wheat dough. item.description: Samosas are a popular savory snack originating from the Indian subcontinent. item.title: What percentage of Indians are vegetarian?
item.description: Approximately 30-40% of the population in India is estimated to follow a vegetarian diet. However, this percentage can vary depending on the region, cultural practices, and religious beliefs. item.title: What is the most expensive spice in the world when listed by weight?
item.description: The most expensive spice in the world, when listed by weight, is saffron. Saffron is derived from the stigma (the female reproductive part) of the Crocus sativus flower. It is renowned for its distinct flavor, aroma, and vibrant color, which adds depth and complexity to dishes. Saffron is used in various cuisines worldwide, particularly in dishes such as paella, risotto, and certain desserts. Se
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K
